articles.title: California Supreme Court demands State Bar answer questions on AI exam controversy
articles.author: Jenny Jarvie
articles.summary: The State Bar of California used artificial intelligence to develop questions for its botched February bar exams. California's highest court was not informed before the exam that the State Bar had allowed its independent psychometrician to use AI to develop a small subset of questions for the exam.

articles.title: AI supercomputers may cost $200B by 2030, demand power of 9 nuclear plants
articles.author: Aamir Khollam
articles.summary: The next generation of AI supercomputers is shaping up to be massive in size, cost, and power demand. Between 2019 and 2025, leading AI data centers' hardware costs and power consumption have doubled annually. A single AI supercomputer in 2030 may cost $200 billion and consume 9 gigawatts of power. This amount of power could keep the lights on in 7 to 9 million homes.

articles.title: AI supercomputers may cost $200B, use 9 nuclear reactors' power
articles.author: Aamir Khollam
articles.summary: The next generation of AI supercomputers is shaping up to be massive in size, cost, and power demand. Between 2019 and 2025, leading AI data centers' hardware costs and power consumption have doubled annually. Private companies now control 80% of all AI-related supercomputing power.

articles.title: Anthropic CEO wants to open the black box of AI models by 2027
articles.author: Maxwell Zeff
articles.summary: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei published an essay on the importance of understanding how AI models work. Anthropic is one of the pioneering companies in mechanistic interpretability, a field that aims to open the black box of AI models and understand why they make the decisions they do. The company has made a few research breakthroughs that have allowed it to better understand its AI models. In the long term, the CEO would like to conduct brain scans of state-of-the-art AI models to identify their weaknesses.

articles.title: Artificial Intelligence (AI) Language Engines, Microsoft PowerShell, User Account Control (UAC) and the Architectural Doorway (AR) – [your]NEWS
articles.author: Robert Terry
articles.summary: Countries are shoring up their digital defenses as global tensions raise the threat of cyberwarfare. The AI language engine component is crucial for AI systems that need to interact with and understand human language. Hackers are focusing on tricking the large language model (LLM), which uses deep learning, neural networks, etc., to learn patterns and relationships between words and phrases. Most technologists would prefer to make their version of science fiction a reality within their computers (networks).

articles.title: AI Stocks to Watch for Explosive Growth in Late 2025
articles.author: support101@QUE.com
articles.summary: As we approach late 2025, investors are keenly eyeing AI stocks for their potential to deliver explosive growth. Several companies are leading the charge in AI development and implementation. NVIDIA remains a powerhouse in the AI sector, benefiting from its indispensable role in the development of graphic processing units (GPUs) essential for AI processing. Tesla's AI initiatives make it a noteworthy contender for late 2025 explosive growth, while Alphabet, the parent company of Google, consistently ranks as a frontrunner. Amazon is embedding AI into its core operations and product offerings. Palantir Technologies offers platforms that transform data into actionable insights.

articles.title: Workers could save 122 hours a year by adopting AI in admin tasks, says Google
articles.author: Paul Sandle
articles.summary: Britain could gain 400 billion pounds ($533 billion) from AI-driven growth if it trained its workforce. Google's pilot scheme in the UK showed workers could save more than 120 hours a year by using AI in administrative tasks. Two thirds of workers had never used generative AI at work.

articles.title: Perplexity is building a browser in part to collect customer data for targeted ads
articles.author: Anna Washenko
articles.summary: Perplexity is building its own browser called Comet. CEO Aravind Srinivas wants to collect user data and sell them targeted advertisements. Comet is built on Chromium, the open-source browser base from Google. In the ongoing hearings about Google and its potential sale of Chrome, Chief Business Officer Dmitry Shevelenko doesn't want OpenAI to buy Chrome.

articles.title: Trump signs executive order pushing AI education in schools
articles.summary: The executive order gives agencies 180 days to develop AI education resources for the AI education. It also gives them 180 days for developing AI education materials for the general public.    i.e. it gives them the opportunity to learn about artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Software Development Has Changed — Here's Why It Matters for Jewish-Owned Businesses
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is making custom, high-quality software faster and more affordable. Bitbean's Artisanal Intelligence initiative has made premium software up to 80% more affordable, giving small and mid-size businesses access to tools that used to be out of reach.

articles.title: BBB study explains how scammers are using AI tools
articles.author: WRAL
articles.summary: Scammers sell stolen personal data on the dark web using AI to target victims. Identity theft will cost $125M in 2023, as hacker forums advertise stolen data on dark web. 5.5 On Your Side study explains how scammers are using AI tools.

articles.title: Publisher Ziff Davis sues OpenAI for copyright infringement
articles.author: Blake Brittain
articles.summary: Ziff Davis sued OpenAI in Delaware federal court on Thursday. Ziff Davis' publications include tech news outlets ZDNet, PCMag, CNET and IGN and advice website Lifehacker. The new lawsuit adds to a web of high-stakes copyright cases brought by news outlets, authors, visual artists and others against AI companies.

articles.title: OpenAI rolls out a 'lightweight' version of its ChatGPT deep research tool
articles.author: Kyle Wiggers
articles.summary: OpenAI is rolling out a lightweight version of its ChatGPT deep research tool. It's cheaper to serve and enables the company to up usage limits. The tool will be available to ChatGpt Plus, Team, and Pro users starting today and to Enterprise and educational users next week.

articles.title: New Rules for 2026 Oscars Enforce Member Film Viewership and AI Guidelines
articles.author: The Epoch Times
articles.summary: The 98th annual Academy Awards will take place on April 21. There will be a preliminary round of voting to determine a shortlist of 10 films. Casting Directors Branch members will be invited to view a 'bake-off' presentation of the shortlisted achievements.

articles.title: AI speeds up analysis work for humans, two federal cyber officials say
articles.author: Tim Starks
articles.summary: Two federal cybersecurity officials said Thursday that they're using artificial intelligence to conduct tasks that speed up the work of human analysts. AI is an important contributor to a variety of security-related administrative jobs like accreditation and compliance, and for the Department of the Air Force as it undertakes modernization efforts. Cyber Command recently touted how AI is speeding up analysis of network traffic for malicious activity.

articles.title: Should We Start Taking the Feelings of AI Seriously?
articles.author: Mike Kai Chen
articles.summary: Tech columnist believes in humanism and believes technology should help people, rather than disempower or replace them. Anthropic, the AI company that made the Claude chatbot, is studying 'model welfare' - the idea that AI models might soon become conscious and deserve some kind of moral status.

articles.title: AI Jesus Is Taking Confessions via Video Chat
articles.author: Sammi Caramela
articles.summary: There's a website called aijesus.live that allows visitors to have video calls with 'AI Jesus' during which you can confess your sins, submit requests, and gain religious guidance. The project started as a joke by artists Ben Polkinghorne, Zach Bishop, and Chris Chapman.

articles.title: Sierra Co-Founder Bret Taylor on AI agents' role in an evolving global landscape
articles.summary: CNBC's Kate Rooney sits down with Sierra co-founder Bret Taylor to talk about the rapid improvements and cost reductions of consumer-facing AI models and the platform's new partnership with Minted online marketplace. Kate Rooney also discusses the impact of geopolitical turmoil on AI spending.

articles.title: Saying ‘Thank You' to ChatGPT Is Costly. But Maybe It's Worth the Price.
articles.summary: ChatGPT platforms like OpenAI and Anthropic are developing chatbots with artificial intelligence. It costs a lot of energy and money to run the chatbots, so it's a good idea to be polite to them. How one treats a chatbot depends on how one views artificial intelligence itself.

articles.title: China's military aims to harness the coming ‘ChatGPT for robotics'
articles.summary: Recent years have witnessed an unprecedented surge in robotics capabilities, driven by the transformative power of AI. China is aggressively pursuing humanoid robotics. The Beijing Humanoid Robot Innovation Center's 'Tiangong' robot has 3D vision, high-precision inertial measurement units, and CPUs capable of 550 trillion operations per second.

articles.title: Developers of AI Superintelligence Know It Endangers Humanity: Roman Yampolskiy
articles.author: The Epoch Times
articles.summary: NTD's Lee Hall sits down with AI safety expert professor Roman Yampolskiy. He says we are only a couple of years away from the development of artificial intelligence and it's a good thing to be aware of AI's safety features.

articles.title: Adobe plans to launch its own mobile app for AI image generation
articles.summary: Adobe wants to make iPhone and Android apps that let you generate images on the go using AI chatbot called Firefly. The app will integrate Adobe's next-gen AI image generation models and AI tools from OpenAI, Google, and others. It will also let users create video, audio, and vectors with 'unmatched creative control' in the app. Firefly boards beta is a collaborative AI-powered space where teams can start moonboarding and storyboarding.

articles.title: Posted Apr 24, 2025 at 5:07 PM EDT
articles.author: Emma Roth
articles.summary: Apple is moving its robotics team under the leadership of John Ternus, the senior vice president of hardware engineering, to focus on underlying artificial intelligence technology instead of AI chief John Giannandrea, who was recently replaced as the head of Siri by John Wojciech.

articles.title: Artificial intelligence elicits concern, uncertainty, even as many see potential benefits — CBS News poll
articles.author: Kabir
articles.summary: Americans are mixed about the impact of artificial intelligence on work and the economy. College grads are more likely than those without college degrees to see the development of AI and AI companies as good for the economy, while college degree holders report higher levels of understanding of AI than other Americans. Half of Americans are concerned about AI being used to create false or misleading content.

articles.title: Professor says xAI turbines don't affect air quality if company's claims are true
articles.author: Samuel Hardiman
articles.summary: Professor Chunrong Jia found that xAI's natural gas turbines do not threaten local air quality in Southwest Memphis. He used information from the xAI application to make 15 of its 30-plus turbines permanent. The city did not pay Jia for the modeling work.

articles.title: Alphabet's (NASDAQ:GOOGL) Q1: Beats On Revenue
articles.author: Max Juang
articles.summary: Alphabet announced better-than-expected revenue in Q1 CY2025, with sales up 12% year on year to $90.23 billion. GAAP profit of $2.81 per share was 40.1% above analysts' consensus estimates. Google Search revenue was $50.7 billion, Google Cloud revenue $12.26 billion, YouTube revenue $8.93 billion and Google Services operating profit $32.68 billion. The company's market capitalization is $1.91 trillion.

articles.title: Perplexity Introduces an iOS Voice Assistant Amid Apple AI Delays
articles.author: CNET
articles.summary: Perplexity has just introduced a new voice mode for its AI chatbot, Siri, on its iPhone app. It's not quite as smart as Siri, but it's a step forward for the chatbot's current capabilities. It has a new Siri-like voice mode.

articles.title: No, AI systems cannot feel self-aware or conscious in any way, says Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: Demis Hassabis is the co-founder and CEO of Google DeepMind. He believes that AI systems cannot feel self-aware or conscious in any way. He warns that as AI becomes more autonomous, keeping these systems safe, aligned and conscious is important.

articles.title: Google's AI Overviews now reach more than 1.5 billion people every month
articles.author: Jay Peters
articles.summary: Google's AI-powered search tool has 1.5 billion users per month. Google earned $90.2 billion in Q1, a 12 percent increase year-over-year. The company passed 270 million subscriptions. Google is facing antitrust cases brought by the US Department of Justice and lost its ad tech monopoly case.

articles.title: Perfect Corp. Named ‘AI Company of the Year' at 2025 RetailTech Breakthrough Awards
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: Perfect Corp. has been named 'AI Company of the Year' at the prestigious 2025 RetailTech Breakthrough Awards. Recognition highlights the company's pioneering AI Skin Analysis technology transforming the skincare retail experience. The technology provides instant, dermatologist-grade assessments by analyzing 15 key skin concerns.

articles.title: Data Science Interview Preparation Course 2025 For Top Data Scientist Jobs at Google Amazon Meta Apple Netflix
articles.author: Interview Kickstart
articles.summary: Interview Kickstart has designed its Data Science Course to equip professionals with the skills necessary to navigate and leverage the evolving AI/ML industry. The course also equips the learners with the interview skills required to crack data science roles in FAANG companies. The program's structure accommodates working professionals, with live classes scheduled on weekends and evening coaching sessions.

articles.title: 'Poisoned' AI models can unleash real-world chaos; study shows how these attacks could be prevented
articles.author: Angela Nicoletti
articles.summary: FIU cybersecurity researchers used federated learning and blockchain to more securely train AI. The team's innovative approach successfully detected and removed dishonest data before it could compromise training datasets. FIU is working with collaborators from the National Center for Transportation Cybersecurity and Resiliency to leverage cutting-edge quantum encryption for protecting the data and systems.

articles.title: Police apprehensive about AI as surveillance tech grows, Michigan study shows
articles.author: Keely Quinlan
articles.summary: The use of surveillance technology by Michigan law enforcement agencies has increased over the last nine years. However, many agencies are wary of using artificial intelligence tools in policing. The findings were gathered through the Michigan Public Policy Survey of all 1,856 local governments, their leaders and local law enforcement.

articles.title: Woman says ChatGPT saved her life by helping detect cancer, which doctors missed
articles.author: Melissa Rudy
articles.summary: Lauren Bannon, 40, has Hashimoto's disease, rheumatoid arthritis and cancer. She used ChatGPT chatbot to find out if she had the disease. She had an operation to remove her thyroid and two lymph nodes from her neck.

articles.title: OpenAI wants its 'open' AI model to call models in the cloud for help
articles.author: Maxwell Zeff
articles.summary: For the first time in five years, OpenAI is preparing an AI system that's truly 'open' and not gated behind an API. The company is aiming for an early summer launch and targeting performance superior to open models from Meta and DeepSeek. It's unclear if the open model will have the ability to access some of the many tools OpenAI's models can use.

articles.title: Trump signs education orders, including overhaul of college accreditations • Ohio Capital Journal
articles.author: Shauneen Miranda
articles.summary: President Donald Trump signed a series of education-related executive orders Wednesday. The orders are related to accreditation in higher education, school discipline policies, historically Black colleges and universities, artificial intelligence in education and workforce development. Trump wants to reform the system responsible for ensuring higher education institutions meet quality standards.

articles.title: No, AI systems cannot feel self-aware or conscious in any way, says Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis
articles.author: TOI Tech Desk
articles.summary: Demis Hassabis is the co-founder and CEO of Google DeepMind. In an interview with CBS's Scott Pelley, Hassabis said that AI systems cannot feel self-aware or conscious in any way. However, he doesn't rule out the possibility that AI might acquire some feeling of self-awareness. He also emphasises the importance of guiding AI's development so they remain consistent with human values.

articles.title: United Arab Emirates first nation to use AI to write laws
articles.author: The Hill
articles.summary: The United Arab Emirates will become the first nation in the world to rely on artificial intelligence to write new federal and local laws and review and amend existing legislation and other procedures. The new legislative system, powered by artificial intelligence, will make the process faster and more precise.

articles.title: OpenAI Wants to Go For-Profit. Experts Say Regulators Should Step In
articles.summary: Dozens of prominent figures are urging the Attorneys General of California and Delaware to block OpenAI's controversial plan to turn its non-profit arm into a public benefit corporation. If the plan is not implemented by the end of the year, it could cost the company $20 billion and hamstring future fundraising.

articles.title: Google's Gemini usage is skyrocketing, but rivals like ChatGPT and Meta AI are still blowing it out of the water
articles.summary: Gemini chatbot has 350 million monthly active users and 35 million daily active users, according to Google. The slide was displayed during the remedies phase of Google's search antitrust case. The court hearing is slated to run three weeks and the remedies ruling is expected by the end of the summer.

articles.title: Motorola's New Razr Flip Phones Cram in AI from Nearly Everyone Except OpenAI
articles.author: Gizmodo
articles.summary: Moto AI on the Razr, Razr+, Razr+ and Razr Ultra is basically like the Avengers. It works like a motorbike AI. It can be controlled by voice commands. It's available on Razr and Razra+. It's also available on the Razr+.

articles.title: Google's Gemini usage is skyrocketing, but rivals like ChatGPT and Meta AI are still blowing it out of the water
articles.author: nmusumeci@businessinsider.com
articles.summary: Gemini chatbot has 350 million monthly active users and 35 million daily active users as of late March. It launched in 2023 and its daily usage has nearly quadrupled from the 9 million active users it recorded in October of last year. OpenAI's ChatGPT and Meta AI are still leading the pack in the generative AI market.

articles.title: Google's Gemini usage is skyrocketing, but rivals like ChatGPT and Meta AI are still blowing it out of the water
articles.author: Natalie Musumeci
articles.summary: Google's AI chatbot Gemini has seen massive user growth. It has 350 million monthly active users and 35 million daily active users as of late March. However, it's still way behind rivals like ChatGPT and Meta AI. The data was shown in court as a way to highlight the competitive nature of the generative AI space.

articles.title: OpenAI Wants to Go For-Profit. Experts Say Regulators Should Step In
articles.author: Harry Booth
articles.summary: Dozens of prominent figures are urging Attorneys General of California and Delaware to block OpenAI's plan to convert from its nonprofit-controlled structure to a for-profit company. OpenAI was founded in 2015 as a non-profit, with its stated mission to ensure that artificial general intelligence (AGI) 'benefits all of humanity' rather than advancing "the private gain of any person". In December, OpenAI proposed transforming its capped-profit arm into a public benefit corporation.

articles.title: How AI Use is Evolving Over Time [Infographic]
articles.author: Andrew Hutchinson
articles.summary: People are using AI tools like ChatGPT for therapy, life organization, and companionship. The report on the Visual Capitalist blog is an overview of how AI use is evolving over time. It is an interesting snapshot of the current state of AI use.

articles.title: AI Models Struggle to Predict Social Interactions, Johns Hopkins Study Finds
articles.author: India New England News
articles.summary: Humans outperform current AI models in interpreting social interactions within moving scenes. This is critical for technologies like self-driving cars, assistive robots, and other AI-driven systems designed to navigate the complexities of the real world. Johns Hopkins University researchers found a significant gap between AI performance and human perception, especially in dynamic situations.

articles.title: AI is taking a toll on the environment
articles.author: Patrick Berry
articles.summary: Torrey Trust is a Professor of Learning Technology at UMass Amherst. He explains the key factors about AI that we all need to be aware of and why they are important to be careful with them.   Â      .

articles.title: YouTube Tests Video Carousel in Google's AI Overview for Product and Location Searches
articles.author: Trishla Ostwal
articles.summary: YouTube is experimenting with a video carousel of search results that appears in AI Overviews, Google's AI-powered search experience. The feature is being tested with a small group of YouTube Premium members in the U.S. for select English-language queries. The search results are tailored to queries focused on shopping and location-based information.

articles.title: FAU Engineering Lands U.S. DOD Grant for Testing Connected AI Autonomy (FAU - Florida Atlantic University)
articles.author: Public Technologies
articles.summary: Dimitris Pados is principal investigator, professor, director of CA-AI and a fellow of FAU I-SENSE in the Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science. He has made a landmark move to redefine artificial intelligence in a landmark way.

articles.title: Trump unveils sweeping order to bring AI into US education
articles.author: Alexandra Kelley
articles.summary: The White House released a new executive order on Wednesday that aims to bring education in artificial intelligence technologies and tools to schools at the K-12 level. The order also calls for the creation of a new task force and allocation of federal grant programs to support the expansion of AI curricula. The task force has 90 days to make plans for a Presidential Artificial Intelligence Challenge.

articles.title: OpenAI eyes $174 billion in sales by 2030
articles.author: Nileena Sunil
articles.summary: OpenAI is projecting an increase in revenue from $4 billion in 2024 to $174 billion in 2030. Revenue from AI agents is expected to rise from $3 billion in 2025 to $29 billion in 2029. Monetization efforts for ChatGPT's free users are scheduled to begin in 2026. SoftBank is planning to invest $3billion annually in OpenAI's agent products.

articles.title: San Mateo supervisors pledge 'responsible' approach to saving county jobs in age of AI
articles.author: Local News Matters
articles.summary: The San Mateo County Board of Supervisors approved a resolution that requires departments to suggest new jobs to create if positions are cut due to the implementation of artificial intelligence. The board also agreed to create a subcommittee that will prepare a study session on the impacts of AI for the county workforce and improving efficiency in county operations.

articles.title: I asked AI to predict the NFL Draft 2025, here's what ChatGPT, Gemini, and Manus ...
articles.author: Tech Radar
articles.summary: Can AI predict the 2025 NFL Draft? We're about to find out.   Â. Â   i.e. it can predict the NFL Draft's outcome using AI technology. It can be used to predict the future of the NFL.

articles.title: Credo AI Named to the 2025 CB Insights' List of the 100 Most Innovative AI Startups
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: Credo AI has been named to CB Insights' AI 100 list. Credo AI is the world's leading provider of AI governance software.      Â   "Being named to the AI 100 is a testament to Credo's mission to pioneer and lead a trust renaissance in artificial intelligence"

articles.title: ServiceNow Reports First Quarter 2025 Financial Results
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: ServiceNow announced financial results for its first quarter ended March. ServiceNow's position as the platinum standard for enterprise-grade AI drove these outstanding first quarter results, according to the company's press release. The company's stock is trading on the NYSE at NYSE: NOW.

articles.title: Researchers are Using AI to Understand what Animals are Saying
articles.summary: AI is reshaping many aspects of life, but so far its applications have focused on humans. Scientists are using AI to study nonhuman animal communication with unprecedented depth and precision. The coming years will redefine humanity's relationship with other species. Scientists motivated by a desire to protect the rights and well-being of nonhuman animals must take care and be ethical.

articles.title: Using AI to Understand what Animals are Saying
articles.author: David Gruber
articles.summary: AI is reshaping many aspects of life, but so far its applications have focused on humans. New technologies are unveiling messages beyond the reach of the human senses. Scientists are studying nonhuman animal communication with unprecedented depth and precision. The research on sperm whales could help extend some of the rights normally bestowed on humans to nonhuman animals.

articles.title: Researchers are Using AI to Understand what Animals are Saying
articles.author: David Gruber
articles.summary: AI is reshaping many aspects of life, but so far its applications have focused on humans. New technologies are unveiling messages beyond the reach of the human senses. Scientists are studying nonhuman animal communication with unprecedented depth and precision. Cetaceans' songs inspired the 'Save the Whales' campaign, which prevented several whale species from going extinct.

articles.title: Perplexity AI enters the smartphone market with Motorola partnership
articles.author: Hayden Field
articles.summary: Perplexity AI is bringing its AI search engine technology directly into Motorola smartphones. Motorola is the first smartphone brand to integrate Perplexity directly into a device. The integration is about gaining users rather than revenue. It follows OpenAI's high-profile Apple partnership introduced in December.

articles.title: The Mediator: NEAR CTO Eric Winer on our AI-Agent Future
articles.author: Coin Desk
articles.summary: Eric Winer is the CTO of NEAR AI. He wants to instruct Llama or Claude or GPT models to post on Twitter on his behalf. He has spent over a decade building bridges between cutting-edge technology and everyday users and now he's pursuing artificial intelligence.

articles.title: ChatGPT's Cancer Diagnosis: Confirmed a Year Later
articles.author: Archyde News Service
articles.summary: AI chatbot flagged Marly Garnreiter's blood cancer nearly a year before medical professionals confirmed the diagnosis. The use of AI in healthcare is growing at a CAGR of 38.2% from 2022 to 2030 in the United States. There are concerns about the potential risks and benefits of using AI for medical diagnosis.

articles.title: AI coding tools could bring us the ‘one-employee unicorn'
articles.author: Mark Sullivan
articles.summary: AI-first companies use AI and agents to complete tasks before hiring employees. Anysphere, the company behind the Cursor AI coding tool, has only 20 employees. Windsurf, a coding tool maker, has reached $40 million in ARR, up from $12 million at the end of 2024. Nexad, which develops and deploys AI-native advertising within AI applications, has just six employees but has already reached 30 million users.

articles.title: Florida bill criminalizing explicit AI-generated photos passes. Pensacola case prompted it
articles.author: Mollye Barrows
articles.summary: Senate Bill 1180 criminalizes the creation of explicit AI-generated photos of real people without their permission. It was sponsored by Sen. Don Gaetz in response to a Pensacola case involving a high school student who downloaded images of girls and young women and altered them to appear 'nude' using an AI-powered app. The new law will take effect on October 1st.

articles.title: Google exec reveals terrifying prediction for future of AI
articles.author: The Daily Mail
articles.summary: Demis Hassabis, CEO of DeepMind at Google, predicts that artificial intelligence will have all the capabilities that humans do within the next decade. He finds the rapid development of AI a bit scary, but promises it will be better than humans within a decade.

articles.title: Saying ‘Thank You' to Chat GPT Uses Energy. Should You Do It Anyway?
articles.summary: ChatGPT platforms like OpenAI and Anthropic are developing chatbots with artificial intelligence. It costs a lot of energy and money to run the chatbots, so it's a good idea to be polite to them. How one treats a chatbot depends on how one views artificial intelligence itself.

articles.title: Developers of AI Superintelligence Know It Endangers Humanity: Roman Yampolskiy
articles.summary: Professor Roman Yampolskiy is an AI safety expert. He says we are only a couple of years away from AI superintelligence that will endanger humanity. He claims the companies developing AI are aware of the danger, but are driven by technological competition and profit.

articles.title: Microsoft's design chief on human creation in the AI era
articles.author: Tom Warren
articles.summary: Jon Friedman is the corporate vice president of design and research at Microsoft. His job has changed in recent months because of AI. He believes that AI will be used as a tool for creators and designers instead of replacing them. He used DALL-E to illustrate his son's book about managing childhood anxiety last year, and recently used AI tools to edit videos and create a website.

articles.title: Anthropic is launching a new program to study AI 'model welfare'
articles.author: Kyle Wiggers
articles.summary: Anthropic has started a research program to study "model welfare" of AI models. There's no strong evidence that future AI systems could be conscious or have experiences that warrant ethical consideration. Many academics believe that AI today can't approximate consciousness or the human experience and won't be able to in the future.

articles.title: WhatsApp has added a new AI feature and you can't get rid of it
articles.author: Rob Waugh
articles.summary: WhatsApp has rolled out a new AI chatbot called Meta AI. It can only be used in some countries and cannot be disabled. Some users are angry about it. WhatsApp says it's an optional feature and people can choose not to use it.

articles.title: Saying ‘Thank You' to Chat GPT Is Costly. Should You Do It Anyway?
articles.summary: ChatGPT platforms like OpenAI and Anthropic are developing chatbots with artificial intelligence. It costs a lot of energy and money to run the chatbots, so it's a good idea to be polite to them. How one treats a chatbot depends on how one views artificial intelligence itself.

articles.title: Oregon awards $10 million to train workers for artificial intelligence in collaboration with Nvidia
articles.author: Mike Rogoway
articles.summary: Gov. Tina Kotek designated $10 million in state funds to train Oregon workers to develop artificial intelligence technology. The state will work with semiconductor designer Nvidia to establish an 'AI Ambassador Program' on Oregon college campuses. Nvidia dominates the artificial intelligence market with advanced chips that give computers the power to engage in complex reasoning.

articles.title: Saying ‘Thank You' to ChatGPT Is Costly. But Maybe It's Worth the Price.
articles.author: Sopan Deb
articles.summary: Sam Altman, the chief executive of the artificial intelligence company OpenAI, explains the cost of adding 'Please!' or 'Thank you!' to chatbot prompts. Every additional word as part of that ask increases the cost for a server. A Pew Research study found that 54 percent of people who own smart speakers such as Amazon Echo or Google Home reported saying 'please' when speaking to them.

articles.title: Saying ‘Thank You' to Chat GPT Is Costly. Should You Do It Anyway?
articles.author: Sopan Deb
articles.summary: Sam Altman, the chief executive of the artificial intelligence company OpenAI, explains the cost of adding an extra 'Please!' or 'Thank you!' to chatbot prompts. Every single ask of a chatbot costs money and energy, and every additional word as part of that ask increases the cost for a server. A Pew Research study found that 54 percent of people who own smart speakers such as Amazon Echo or Google Home reported saying 'please' when speaking to them.

articles.title: Edge AI Software Market worth $8.88 billion by 2031- Exclusive Report by MarketsandMarkets™
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: The Edge AI Software Market is projected to grow from USD 2.40 billion in 2025 to USD 8.88 billion by 2031, at a CAGR of 24.4% during the forecast period, according to a new report by "Edge AI Software"

articles.title: Is AI Doomsday Talk Distracting Us From Real Problems It's Already Causing Today?
articles.author: Studyfinds Staff
articles.summary: People aren't distracted by doomsday AI headlines, according to new research from the University of Zurich. People are more concerned about present-day harms caused by AI than long-term threats. The research challenges the idea that we must choose between focusing on today's AI issues or future risks.

articles.title: Google AI Overviews' embarrassing new problem is even funnier than pizza glue
articles.summary: AI Overviews hallucinates an explanation for the fake idiom 'two buses going in the wrong direction is better than one going the right way'. It's another embarrassment for Google's Search-related AI plans. The good news is that AI Overviews isn't enabled everywhere, for example in the EU.

articles.title: AI supercomputers could need as much power as a city by 2030
articles.summary: Today's most powerful supercomputer needs around 300MW of power, which is equivalent to about 250,000 households. Today's largest supercomputer — the Colossus system, built to full scale within 214 days, needs about 9GW of power. The next generation of supercomputers will be bigger and require more power. Companies like Microsoft, Google, and others are investing in AI chips to power them.

articles.title: Should We Start Taking the Welfare of A.I. Seriously?
articles.author: Kevin Roose
articles.summary: Anthropic, the company that made the Claude chatbot, is studying 'model welfare' - the idea that A.I. models might soon become conscious and deserve some kind of moral status. articles.title: Films Made With Artificial Intelligence Now Eligible For Top Oscar Honours, Academy Announces
articles.author: News18
articles.summary: The Academy confirmed AI-made films can compete for Oscars, but human involvement will influence the winners. The Academy confirmed that AI- made films can be nominated for Oscars but not win. The winner will be decided by the public vote. The voting will take place on February 25th.
